definition: to stroll/to visit
to walk (side part of split character)
mad/wild/violent
to take a walk/to window-shop/to stroll down the street
to roam around/to have a stroll
to roam around/to have a stroll
to stroll
to go sightseeing/to spend one's leisure time wandering around
to wander aimlessly

sentences.english: Strolling the flower market for two rounds, yet I ended up coming back with hands empty.
sentences.chinese: 把花市逛了两圈，仍然空手而回。

sentences.english: Then Abanazar and Aladdin walked through the market and looked at the shops.
sentences.chinese: 然后他们就开始逛市场，看了很多家商店。

sentences.english: Afterwards you can go to the neighbouring zoo .
sentences.chinese: 嗣后，你可以逛一下附近的动物园。

sentences.english: They made the rounds of the shopping center.
sentences.chinese: 他们在购物中心一家店一家店地挨着逛。

sentences.english: I don't want anyone with factories or prostitutes or concubines.
sentences.chinese: 我不找资本家，也不要逛窑子或有小老婆的人。

sentences.english: I was busy in FHC in daytime, after out off office I went out.
sentences.chinese: 白天就呆在展馆里面忙，晚上就到外面逛。

sentences.english: Aside from the bargains, flea markets always have a great atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 除了捡便宜，逛跳蚤市场最有趣的是感受人情味。

sentences.english: Garden party movie playing an appointment with the visiting world.
sentences.chinese: 园游会影片在播放这个世界约好一起逛。

sentences.english: I've been shopping in gazillion department stores with my mom throughout the week.
sentences.chinese: 这整个星期，我和我妈妈已经逛了成千上万家店铺了。

sentences.english: Well, I heard American people love hanging out in bars.
sentences.chinese: 对了，我听说美国人都很喜欢逛酒吧。

sentences.english: I knocked around in Tianjin this holiday.
sentences.chinese: 这个假期我去天津逛了逛。

sentences.english: I knocked around in Tianjin this holiday.
sentences.chinese: 这个假期我去天津逛了逛。

sentences.english: After visiting Chenghuangmiao, we went to Pudong District to visit Dongfang Pearl Towel.
sentences.chinese: 逛完城隍庙后，我们乘车去浦东参观东方明珠。

sentences.english: There is nothing more interesting than to check out the flower market.
sentences.chinese: 没有一件事比逛花市更有趣的了。

sentences.english: By this time I was tramping the streets again.
sentences.chinese: 这时，我又在大街上逛了起来。

sentences.english: Even in brothels he wanted to monopolize because he had money.
sentences.chinese: 逛暗娼他也想独占，因为他有钱。

variant of 軋馬路|轧马路[ya4 ma3 lu4]
lit. flower viewing from horseback (idiom); a fleeting glance in passing/fig. superficial understanding from cursory observation/to make a quick judgment based on inadequate information
